ai-an6:11.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these six warm-hearted qualities.
ai-an6:11.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by six?
ai-an6:11.1.3_0: Firstly, a mendicant consistently treats their spiritual companions with bodily kindness, both in public and in private. This is a warm-hearted quality.
ai-an6:11.2.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant consistently treats their spiritual companions with verbal kindness, both in public and in private. This too is a warm-hearted quality.
ai-an6:11.3.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant consistently treats their spiritual companions with mental kindness ...
ai-an6:11.4.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant shares without reservation any material possessions they have gained by legitimate means, even the food placed in the alms-bowl, using them in common with their ethical spiritual companions. This too is a warm-hearted quality.
ai-an6:11.5.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant lives according to the precepts shared with their spiritual companions, both in public and in private. ai-an6:11.6.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant lives according to the view shared with their spiritual companions, both in public and in private. That view is noble and emancipating, and leads one who practices it to the complete ending of suffering. This too is a warm-hearted quality.
ai-an6:11.7.1_0: These are the six warm-hearted qualities.”

ai-an6:27.1.1_0: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha,
ai-an6:27.1.2_0: “Sir, how many occasions are there for going to see an esteemed mendicant?”
ai-an6:27.1.3_0: “Mendicant, there are six occasions for going to see an esteemed mendicant.
ai-an6:27.2.1_0: What are the teachings grouped by six?
ai-an6:27.2.2_0: Firstly, there’s a time when a mendicant’s heart is overcome and mired in sensual desire, and they don’t truly understand the escape from sensual desire that has arisen. On that occasion they should go to an esteemed mendicant and say:
ai-an6:27.2.3_0: ‘My heart is overcome and mired in sensual desire, and I don’t truly understand the escape from sensual desire that has arisen.
ai-an6:27.2.4_0: Venerable, please teach me how to give up sensual desire.’
ai-an6:27.2.5_0: That mendicant teaches Dhamma for giving up sensual desire.
ai-an6:27.2.6_0: This is the first occasion for going to see an esteemed mendicant.
ai-an6:27.3.1_0: Furthermore, there’s a time when a mendicant’s heart is overcome and mired in ill will ...
ai-an6:27.3.2_0: ‘My heart is overcome and mired in ill will ...
ai-an6:27.3.3_0: Venerable, please teach me how to give up ill will.’
ai-an6:27.3.4_0: That mendicant teaches Dhamma for giving up ill will.
ai-an6:27.3.5_0: This is the second occasion for going to see an esteemed mendicant.
ai-an6:27.4.1_0: Furthermore, there’s a time when a mendicant’s heart is overcome and mired in dullness and drowsiness ...
ai-an6:27.4.2_0: ‘My heart is overcome and mired in dullness and drowsiness ...
ai-an6:27.4.3_0: Venerable, please teach me how to give up dullness and drowsiness.’
ai-an6:27.4.4_0: That mendicant teaches Dhamma for giving up dullness and drowsiness.
ai-an6:27.4.5_0: This is the third occasion for going to see an esteemed mendicant.
ai-an6:27.5.1_0: Furthermore, there’s a time when a mendicant’s heart is overcome and mired in restlessness and remorse ...
ai-an6:27.5.2_0: ‘My heart is overcome and mired in restlessness and remorse ...
ai-an6:27.5.3_0: Venerable, please teach me how to give up restlessness and remorse.’
ai-an6:27.5.4_0: That mendicant teaches Dhamma for giving up restlessness and remorse.
ai-an6:27.5.5_0: This is the fourth occasion for going to see an esteemed mendicant.
ai-an6:27.6.1_0: Furthermore, there’s a time when a mendicant’s heart is overcome and mired in doubt ...
ai-an6:27.6.2_0: ‘My heart is overcome and mired in doubt, and I don’t truly know and see any escape from doubt that has arisen.
ai-an6:27.6.3_0: Venerable, please teach me how to give up doubt.’
ai-an6:27.6.4_0: For that mendicant teaches Dhamma for giving up doubt.
ai-an6:27.6.5_0: This is the fifth occasion for going to see an esteemed mendicant.
ai-an6:27.7.1_0: Furthermore, there’s a time when a mendicant doesn’t understand what kind of meditation they need to focus on in order to end the defilements in the present life. On that occasion they should go to an esteemed mendicant and say:
ai-an6:27.7.2_0: ‘I don’t understand what kind of meditation to focus on in order to end the defilements in the present life.
ai-an6:27.7.3_0: Venerable, please teach me how to end the defilements.’
ai-an6:27.7.4_0: They teach Dhamma for the ending of defilements.
ai-an6:27.7.5_0: This is the sixth occasion for going to see an esteemed mendicant.
ai-an6:27.8.1_0: These are the six occasions for going to see an esteemed mendicant.”
ai-an6:28.1.1_0: At one time several senior mendicants were staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana.
ai-an6:28.1.2_0: Then after the meal, on their return from alms-round, this discussion came up among them while sitting together in the pavilion.
ai-an6:28.1.3_0: “Reverends, how many occasions are there for going to see an esteemed mendicant?”
ai-an6:28.2.1_0: When this was said, one of the senior mendicants asked those senior mendicants,
ai-an6:28.2.2_0: “Reverends, there’s a time after an esteemed mendicant’s meal when they return from alms-round. Having washed their feet they sit down cross-legged, with their body straight, and establish mindfulness right there. That is the proper occasion for going to see an esteemed mendicant.”
ai-an6:28.3.1_0: When this was said, one of the mendicants asked that mendicant,
ai-an6:28.3.2_0: “Reverends, there are no occasions for going to see an esteemed mendicant.
ai-an6:28.3.3_0: For at that time the fatigue from walking and from eating has not faded away.
ai-an6:28.3.4_0: That’s why he’s going to see an esteemed mendicant.
ai-an6:28.3.5_0: There’s a time when an esteemed mendicant has come out of retreat. They sit down cross-legged, with their body straight, and establish mindfulness right there. That is the proper occasion for going to see an esteemed mendicant.”
ai-an6:28.4.1_0: When this was said, one of the mendicants asked that mendicant,
ai-an6:28.4.2_0: “Reverends, there are no occasions for going to see an esteemed mendicant.
ai-an6:28.4.3_0: For at that time they are still practicing the same meditation subject as a foundation of immersion that they focused on during the day.
ai-an6:28.4.4_0: That’s why he’s going to see an esteemed mendicant.
ai-an6:28.4.5_0: There’s a time when an esteemed mendicant has risen at the crack of dawn. They sit down cross-legged, with their body straight, and establish mindfulness right there. That is the proper occasion for going to see an esteemed mendicant.”
ai-an6:28.5.1_0: When this was said, one of the mendicants asked that mendicant,
ai-an6:28.5.2_0: “Reverends, there are no occasions for going to see an esteemed mendicant.
ai-an6:28.5.3_0: For at that time their body is full of vitality and they find it easy to focus on the instructions of the Buddhas.”
ai-an6:28.5.4_0: That’s why he’s going to see an esteemed mendicant.”
ai-an6:28.6.1_0: When this was said, Venerable Mahākaccāna said to those senior mendicants:
ai-an6:28.6.2_0: “Reverends, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
ai-an6:28.6.3_0: ‘Mendicants, there are six occasions for going to see an esteemed mendicant.
ai-an6:28.7.1_0: What are the teachings grouped by six?
ai-an6:28.7.2_0: Firstly, there’s a time when a mendicant’s heart is overcome and mired in sensual desire, and they don’t truly understand the escape from sensual desire that has arisen. On that occasion they should go to an esteemed mendicant and say:
ai-an6:28.7.3_0: “My heart is overcome and mired in sensual desire, and I don’t truly understand the escape from sensual desire that has arisen.
ai-an6:28.7.4_0: Venerable, please teach me how to give up sensual desire.”
ai-an6:28.7.5_0: That mendicant teaches Dhamma for giving up sensual desire.
ai-an6:28.7.6_0: This is the first occasion for going to see an esteemed mendicant.
ai-an6:28.8.1_0: Furthermore, there’s a time when a mendicant’s heart is overcome and mired in ill will ...
ai-an6:28.12.1_0: While they don’t understand what kind of meditation they need to focus on in order to end the defilements in the present life. On that occasion they should go to an esteemed mendicant and say:
ai-an6:28.12.2_0: “I don’t understand what kind of meditation to focus on in order to end the defilements in the present life.
ai-an6:28.12.3_0: Venerable, please teach me how to end the defilements.”
ai-an6:28.12.4_0: They teach Dhamma for the ending of defilements.
ai-an6:28.12.5_0: This is the sixth occasion for going to see an esteemed mendicant.’
ai-an6:28.13.1_0: Reverends, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
ai-an6:28.13.2_0: ‘These are the six occasions for going to see an esteemed mendicant.’”
ai-an6:29.1.1_0: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Udāyī,
ai-an6:29.1.2_0: “ Udāyī, how many topics for recollection are there?”
ai-an6:29.1.3_0: When he said this, Udāyī kept silent.
ai-an6:29.1.4_0: For a second time, the Buddha said to him,
ai-an6:29.1.5_0: “ Udāyī, how many topics for recollection are there?”
ai-an6:29.1.6_0: And for a second time and a second time Udāyī kept silent.
ai-an6:29.1.7_0: and a third time, the Buddha said to him,
ai-an6:29.1.8_0: “ Udāyī, how many topics for recollection are there?”
ai-an6:29.1.9_0: And a second time and a third time Udāyī kept silent.
ai-an6:29.2.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda said to Venerable Udāyī,
ai-an6:29.2.2_0: “Reverend Udāyī, the teacher is addressing you.”
ai-an6:29.2.4_0: It’s when a mendicant recollects many kinds of past lives.
ai-an6:29.2.4_1: There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-an6:29.2.5_0: This is a topic for recollection.”
ai-an6:29.3.3_0: this silly man Udāyī is not committed to the higher mind.
ai-an6:29.3.4_0: Ānanda, how many topics for recollection are there?”
ai-an6:29.4.1_0: “Sir, there are five topics for recollection.
ai-an6:29.4.3_0: Firstly, a mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption ... second absorption ... third absorption.
ai-an6:29.4.4_0: When this topic of recollection is developed and cultivated in this way it leads to blissful meditation in this very life.
ai-an6:29.5.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant focuses on the perception of light, concentrating on the perception of day regardless of whether it is night or day.
ai-an6:29.5.2_0: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.
ai-an6:29.5.3_0: When this topic of recollection is developed and cultivated in this way it leads to knowledge and vision.
ai-an6:29.6.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant examines their own body up from the soles of the feet and down from the tips of the hairs, wrapped in skin and full of many kinds of filth.
ai-an6:29.6.2_0: ‘In this body there is head hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, diaphragm, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, snot, synovial fluid, urine.’
ai-an6:29.6.3_0: When this topic of recollection is developed and cultivated in this way it leads to giving up sensual desire.
ai-an6:29.7.1_0: Furthermore, suppose a mendicant were to see a corpse thrown in a charnel ground. And it had been dead for one, two, or three days, bloated, livid, and festering.
ai-an6:29.7.2_0: Then he arranged his body, thinking:
ai-an6:29.7.3_0: ‘This body is produced by the teachings and has developed so that it is when developed.’
ai-an6:29.8.1_0: Or suppose they were to see a corpse thrown in a charnel ground being devoured by crows, hawks, vultures, herons, dogs, tigers, leopards, jackals, and many kinds of little creatures.
ai-an6:29.8.2_0: Then he arranged his body, thinking:
ai-an6:29.8.3_0: ‘This body is produced by the teachings and has developed so that it is when developed.’
ai-an6:29.9.1_0: Or suppose a corpse was to see a skeleton with flesh and blood, held together by sinews ... a skeleton rid of flesh but smeared with blood, and held together by sinews ...
ai-an6:29.9.2_0: A skeleton without flesh but smeared with blood, and held together by sinews ...
ai-an6:29.9.3_0: A skeleton rid of flesh and blood, held together by sinews ...
ai-an6:29.9.4_0: Bones rid of sinews scattered in every direction. Here a hand-bone, there a foot-bone, here a shin-bone, there a thigh-bone, here a hip-bone, there a rib-bone, here a back-bone, there an arm-bone, here a neck-bone, there a jaw-bone, here a tooth, there the skull ... White bones, the color of shells ... Decrepit bones, heaped in a pile ... Bones rotted and crumbled to powder.
ai-an6:29.9.5_0: Then he arranged his body, thinking:
ai-an6:29.9.6_0: ‘This body is produced by the teachings and has developed so that it is when developed.’
ai-an6:29.9.7_0: When this topic of recollection is developed and cultivated in this way it leads to uprooting the conceit ‘I am’.
ai-an6:29.10.1_0: Furthermore, giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, a mendicant enters and remains in the fourth absorption. It is without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-an6:29.10.2_0: When this topic of recollection is developed and cultivated in this way it leads to the penetration of many elements.
ai-an6:29.10.3_0: These are the five topics for recollection.”
ai-an6:29.11.2_0: Well then, Ānanda, you should also remember this sixth topic for recollection.
ai-an6:29.11.3_0: In this case, a mendicant goes out mindfully, returns mindfully, stands mindfully, sits mindfully, lies down mindfully, and applies themselves to work mindfully.
ai-an6:29.11.4_0: When this topic of recollection is developed and cultivated in this way it leads to mindfulness and situational awareness.”
ai-an6:30.1.3_0: The unsurpassable seeing, listening, acquisition, training, service, and recollection.
ai-an6:30.2.1_0: And what is the unsurpassable seeing?
ai-an6:30.2.2_0: Some people go to see an elephant-treasure, a horse-treasure, a jewel-treasure, or a diverse spectrum of sights; or ascetics and brahmins of wrong view and wrong practice.
ai-an6:30.2.3_0: There is such a seeing, I don’t deny it.
ai-an6:30.2.4_0: That seeing is low, crude, ordinary, ignoble, and pointless. It doesn’t lead to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
ai-an6:30.2.5_0: The unsurpassable seeing is when someone with settled faith and love, sure and devoted, goes to see a Realized One or their disciple. This is in order to purify sentient beings, to get past sorrow and crying, to make an end of pain and sadness, to end the cycle of suffering, and to realize extinguishment.
ai-an6:30.2.6_0: This is called the unsurpassable seeing.
ai-an6:30.3.1_0: But what of the unsurpassable hearing?
ai-an6:30.3.2_0: Some people go to hear the sound of drums, arched harps, singing, or a diverse spectrum of sounds; or ascetics and brahmins of wrong view and wrong practice.
ai-an6:30.3.3_0: There is such a hearing, I don’t deny it.
ai-an6:30.3.4_0: That hearing ... doesn’t lead to extinguishment.
ai-an6:30.3.5_0: The unsurpassable hearing is when someone with settled faith and love, sure and devoted, goes to hear the teaching of a Realized One or one of his disciples. ...
ai-an6:30.3.6_0: This is called the unsurpassable hearing.

ai-an6:52.2.2_0: “Aristocrats, brahmin, have wealth as their ambition. They’re preoccupied with wisdom. They’re dedicated to power. They insist on territory. Their ultimate goal is authority.”
ai-an6:52.3.1_0: “Brahmins, Master Gotama, have what as their ambition? What is their preoccupation? What are they dedicated to? What do they insist on? What is their ultimate goal?”
ai-an6:52.3.2_0: “Brahmins have wealth as their ambition. They’re preoccupied with wisdom. They’re dedicated to the hymns. They insist on sacrifice. Their ultimate goal is the Brahmā realm.”
ai-an6:52.4.1_0: “Householders, Master Gotama, have what as their ambition? What is their preoccupation? What are they dedicated to? What do they insist on? What is their ultimate goal?”
ai-an6:52.4.2_0: “Householders have wealth as their ambition. They’re preoccupied with wisdom. They’re dedicated to their profession. They insist on work. Their ultimate goal is to complete their work.”

ai-an6:52.5.2_0: “Women have a man as their ambition. They’re preoccupied with adornments. They’re dedicated to their children. They insist on being without a co-wife. Their ultimate goal is authority.”
ai-an6:52.6.1_0: “Bandits, Master Gotama, have what as their ambition? What is their preoccupation? What are they dedicated to? What do they insist on? What is their ultimate goal?”
ai-an6:52.6.2_0: “Bandits have theft as their ambition. They’re preoccupied with a hiding place. They’re dedicated to their sword. They insist on darkness. Their ultimate goal is invisibility.”
ai-an6:52.7.1_0: “Ascetics, Master Gotama, have what as their ambition? What is their preocupation? What are they dedicated to? What do they insist on? What is their ultimate goal?”
ai-an6:52.7.2_0: “Ascetics have patience and gentleness as their ambition. They’re preoccupied with wisdom. They’re dedicated to ethical conduct. They insist on owning nothing. Their ultimate goal is extinguishment.”

ai-an6:58.3.1_0: And what are the defilements that should be given up by restraint?
ai-an6:58.3.2_0: Take a mendicant who, reflecting properly, lives restraining the faculty of the eye.
ai-an6:58.3.3_0: For the distressing and feverish defilements that might arise in someone who lives without restraint of the eye faculty do not arise when there is such restraint.
ai-an6:58.3.4_0: Reflecting properly, they live restraining the ear faculty ...
ai-an6:58.3.9_0: For the distressing and feverish defilements that might arise in someone who lives without restraint of the mind faculty do not arise when there is such restraint.
ai-an6:58.3.10_0: These are called the defilements that should be given up by restraint.
ai-an6:58.4.1_0: And what are the defilements that should be given up by using?
ai-an6:58.4.2_0: Take a mendicant who, reflecting properly, takes a robe that they make use of a robe:
ai-an6:58.4.3_0: ‘Only for the sake of warding off cold and heat; for warding off the touch of flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and reptiles; and for covering up the private parts.’
ai-an6:58.4.4_0: Reflecting properly, they eat that alms-food,
ai-an6:58.4.5_0: ‘Not for fun, indulgence, adornment, or decoration, but only to sustain this body, to avoid harm, and to support spiritual practice. In this way, I shall put an end to old discomfort and not give rise to new discomfort, and I will live blamelessly and at ease.’
ai-an6:58.4.6_0: Reflecting properly, they make a dwelling:
ai-an6:58.4.7_0: ‘Only for the sake of warding off cold and heat; for warding off the touch of flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and reptiles; to shelter from harsh weather and to enjoy retreat.’
ai-an6:58.4.8_0: Reflecting properly, they make use of medicines and supplies for the sick:
ai-an6:58.4.9_0: ‘Only for the sake of warding off the pains of illness and to promote good health.’
ai-an6:58.4.10_0: For the distressing and feverish defilements that might arise in someone who lives without using these things do not arise when they are used.
ai-an6:58.4.11_0: These are called the defilements that should be given up by using.
ai-an6:58.5.1_0: And what are the defilements that should be given up by enduring?
ai-an6:58.5.2_0: Take a mendicant who, reflecting properly, endures cold, heat, hunger, and thirst. They endure the touch of flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and reptiles. They endure rude and unwelcome criticism. And they put up with physical pain—sharp, severe, acute, unpleasant, disagreeable, and life-threatening.
ai-an6:58.5.3_0: For the distressing and feverish defilements that might arise in someone who lives without enduring these things do not arise when they are endured.
ai-an6:58.5.4_0: These are called the defilements that should be given up by enduring.
ai-an6:58.6.1_0: And what are the defilements that should be given up by avoiding?
ai-an6:58.6.2_0: Take a mendicant who, reflecting properly, avoids a wild elephant, a wild horse, a wild ox, a wild dog, a snake, a stump, thorny ground, a pit, a cliff, a swamp, and a sewer. Reflecting properly, they avoid sitting on inappropriate seats, walking in inappropriate neighborhoods, and mixing with bad friends—whatever sensible spiritual companions would believe to be a bad setting.
ai-an6:58.6.3_0: For the distressing and feverish defilements that might arise in someone who lives without avoiding these things do not arise when they are avoided.
ai-an6:58.6.4_0: These are called the defilements that should be given up by avoiding.
ai-an6:58.7.1_0: And what are the defilements that should be given up by getting rid?
ai-an6:58.7.2_0: Take a mendicant who, reflecting properly, doesn’t tolerate a sensual,
ai-an6:58.7.4_0: or cruel thought that has arisen.
ai-an6:58.7.5_0: They don’t tolerate any bad, unskillful qualities that have arisen, but give them up, get rid of them, eliminate them, and obliterate them.
ai-an6:58.7.6_0: For the distressing and feverish defilements that might arise in someone who lives without getting rid of these things do not arise when they are gotten rid of.
ai-an6:58.7.7_0: These are called the defilements that should be given up by getting rid.
ai-an6:58.8.1_0: And what are the defilements that should be given up by developing?
ai-an6:58.8.2_0: Take a mendicant who, reflecting properly, develops the awakening factors of mindfulness,
ai-an6:58.8.8_0: equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
ai-an6:58.8.9_0: For the distressing and feverish defilements that might arise in someone who lives without developing these things do not arise when they are developed.
ai-an6:58.8.10_0: These are called the defilements that should be given up by developing.
ai-an6:58.9.1_0: A mendicant with these six factors is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.”
ai-an6:59.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Nādika in the brick house.
ai-an6:59.1.3_0: Then the householder Dārukammika went up to the Buddha.
ai-an6:59.1.6_0: Gifts are given to those mendicants who are perfected or on the path to perfection; they live in the wilderness, eat only alms-food, and wear rag robes.”
ai-an6:59.2.1_0: “Householder, as a layman enjoying sensual pleasures, living at home with your children, using sandalwood imported from Kāsi, wearing garlands, fragrance, and makeup, and accepting gold and money, it’s hard for you to know who is perfected or on the path to perfection.
ai-an6:59.3.1_0: If a mendicant living in the wilderness is restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, loose-tongued, unmindful, lacking situational awareness and immersion, with straying mind and undisciplined faculties,
ai-an6:59.3.3_0: If a mendicant living in the wilderness is not restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, or loose-tongued, but has established mindfulness, situational awareness and immersion, with unified mind and restrained faculties,
ai-an6:59.4.1_0: If a mendicant who lives in the neighborhood of a village is restless ...
ai-an6:59.4.3_0: If a mendicant who lives in the neighborhood of a village is not restless ...
ai-an6:59.5.1_0: If a mendicant who eats only alms-food is restless ...
ai-an6:59.5.3_0: If a mendicant who eats only alms-food is not restless ...
ai-an6:59.6.1_0: If a mendicant who accepts invitations is restless ...
ai-an6:59.6.3_0: If a mendicant who accepts invitations is not restless ...
ai-an6:59.7.1_0: If a mendicant who wears rag robes is restless ...
ai-an6:59.7.3_0: If a mendicant who wears rag robes is not restless ...
ai-an6:59.8.1_0: If a mendicant who wears robes offered by householders is restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, loose-tongued, unmindful, lacking situational awareness and immersion, with straying mind and undisciplined faculties,
ai-an6:59.8.3_0: If a mendicant who wears robes offered by householders is not restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, or loose-tongued, but has established mindfulness, situational awareness and immersion, with unified mind and restrained faculties,
ai-an6:59.9.1_0: Go ahead, householder, give gifts to the Saṅgha.
ai-an6:59.9.2_0: Your mind will become bright and clear,
ai-an6:59.9.3_0: and when your body breaks up, after death, you’ll be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”
ai-an6:59.9.4_0: “Sir, from this day forth I will give gifts to the Saṅgha.”
ai-an6:60.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Benares in the deer park at Isipatana.
ai-an6:60.1.3_0: Now at that time several senior mendicants, after the meal, on their return from alms-round, sat together in the pavilion talking about the teachings.
ai-an6:60.1.4_0: Venerable Citta Hatthisāriputta interrupted them while they were talking.
ai-an6:60.1.5_0: Then Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita said to Venerable Citta Hatthisāriputta,
ai-an6:60.1.6_0: “Venerable, please don’t interrupt the senior mendicants while they’re talking about the teachings. Wait until the end of the discussion.”
ai-an6:60.1.7_0: When he said this, Citta Hatthisāriputta’s companions said to Mahākoṭṭhita,
ai-an6:60.1.8_0: “Venerable, please don’t rebuke Citta Hatthisāriputta. He is astute,
ai-an6:60.1.9_0: and quite capable of talking about the teachings with the senior mendicants.”
ai-an6:60.2.1_0: “It’s not easy to know this, reverends, for those who don’t comprehend another’s mind.
ai-an6:60.2.2_0: Take a person who is the sweetest of the sweet, the most unruffled of the unruffled, the calmest of the calm, so long as they live relying on the Teacher or a spiritual companion in a teacher’s role.
ai-an6:60.2.3_0: But when the teacher approved and agreed with what the Teacher taught for the ascetics of other religions, with monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen; he’s mixing ascetics of other religions, nuns, laymen, and laywomen;

ai-an6:60.3.2_0: Suppose someone were to say that
ai-an6:60.3.2_1: ‘This ox will not be called a cow again invade the crops’. And it’s me.”
ai-an6:60.3.4_0: For it’s quite possible that that ox will snap the ropes or break out of the pen, and then invade the crops.”

ai-an6:60.4.7_0: For it is quite possible that people or cattle and so on will cross over the crossroad, or that the wind and sun will evaporate the moisture so that the dust appears again.”

ai-an6:60.4.10_0: resigns the training and returns to a lesser life.

ai-an6:60.5.2_0: Thinking, ‘I get in the second absorption,’ ...
ai-an6:60.5.3_0: resigns the training and returns to a lesser life.
ai-an6:60.5.4_0: Suppose there was a large pond not far from a town or village.
ai-an6:60.5.5_0: After it rained heavily there the clams and mussels, and pebbles and gravel would vanish.
ai-an6:60.5.6_0: Suppose someone were to say that

ai-an6:60.5.8_0: For it’s quite possible that people or cattle and so on will drink from the pond, or that the wind and sun will evaporate it so that the clams and mussels, and pebbles and gravel appear again.”

ai-an6:60.5.10_0: Thinking, ‘I get in the second absorption,’ ...
ai-an6:60.5.11_0: resigns the training and returns to a lesser life.

ai-an6:60.6.3_0: resigns the training and returns to a lesser life.

ai-an6:60.6.11_0: resigns the training and returns to a lesser life.

ai-an6:60.9.1_0: Then after some time Venerable Citta Hatthisāriputta resigned the training and returned to a lesser life.
ai-an6:60.9.2_0: Then the mendicants who were his companions went up to Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita,
ai-an6:60.9.3_0: “Did Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita comprehend Citta Hatthisāriputta’s mind and know that
ai-an6:60.9.4_0: he had gained such and such meditative attainments, yet he would still resign the training and return to a lesser life?
ai-an6:60.9.5_0: Or did deities tell you about it?”
ai-an6:60.9.6_0: you gained such and such meditative attainments, yet he would still resign the training and return to a lesser life?”
ai-an6:60.9.7_0: “Reverends, I comprehended his mind and knew this.
ai-an6:60.9.8_0: Citta Hatthisāriputta, who had gained such and such meditative attainments, has still resigned the training and returned to a lesser life.
ai-an6:60.9.9_0: And deities also told me about this.”
ai-an6:60.9.10_0: Citta Hatthisāriputta, who had gained such and such meditative attainments, has still resigned the training and returned to a lesser life.”
ai-an6:60.10.1_0: Soon afterwards the monks who were Citta Hatthisāriputta’s companions went to see the Buddha.
ai-an6:60.10.1_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-an6:60.10.2_0: “Sir, Citta Hatthisāriputta, who had gained such and such meditative attainments, has still resigned the training and returned to a lesser life.”
ai-an6:60.11.1_0: And not long after Citta Hatthisāriputta shaved off his hair and beard, dressed in ocher robes, and went forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-an6:60.11.2_0: Then Citta Hatthisāriputta, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, soon realized the supreme culmination of the spiritual path in this very life. He lived having achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-an6:60.11.3_0: He understood: “Rebirth is ended; the spiritual journey has been completed; what had to be done has been done; there is no return to any state of existence.”
ai-an6:60.11.4_0: And Venerable Citta Hatthisāriputta became one of the perfected.
ai-an6:61.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Benares in the deer park at Isipatana.
ai-an6:61.1.3_0: Now at that time, after the meal, on return from alms-round, several senior mendicants sat together in the pavilion and this discussion came up among them,
ai-an6:61.1.4_0: “Reverends, this was said by the Buddha in ‘The Way to the Beyond’, in ‘The Questions of Metteyya’:
ai-an6:61.2.2_0: by the middle, they gain a profession.
ai-an6:61.2.3_0: I declare you the great man,
ai-an6:61.2.4_0: he has escaped the seamstress here.’
ai-an6:61.3.1_0: But what is one end? What’s the second end? What’s the middle? And who is the seamstress?”
ai-an6:61.3.2_0: When this was said, one of the senior mendicants asked those senior mendicants,
ai-an6:61.3.3_0: “Contact, reverends, is one end. The origin of contact is the second end. The cessation of contact is the middle. And craving is the seamstress,
ai-an6:61.3.5_0: That’s how a mendicant directly knows what should be directly known and completely understands what should be completely understood. Knowing and understanding thus they make an end of suffering in this very life.”
ai-an6:61.4.1_0: When this was said, one of the senior mendicants asked those senior mendicants,
ai-an6:61.4.2_0: “The past, reverends, is one end. The future is the second end. The present is the middle. And craving is the seamstress ...
ai-an6:61.4.4_0: That’s how a mendicant directly knows what should be directly known and completely understands what should be completely understood. Knowing and understanding thus they make an end of suffering in this very life.”
ai-an6:61.5.1_0: When this was said, one of the senior mendicants asked those senior mendicants,
ai-an6:61.5.2_0: “Pleasant feeling, reverends, is one end. Painful feeling is the second end. Neutral feeling is the middle. And craving is the seamstress ...
ai-an6:61.5.4_0: That’s how a mendicant directly knows what should be directly known and completely understands what should be completely understood. Knowing and understanding thus they make an end of suffering in this very life.”
ai-an6:61.6.1_0: When this was said, one of the senior mendicants asked those senior mendicants,
ai-an6:61.6.2_0: “Name, reverends, is one end. Form is the second end. Consciousness is the middle. And craving is the seamstress ...
ai-an6:61.6.4_0: That’s how a mendicant directly knows what should be directly known and completely understands what should be completely understood. Knowing and understanding thus they make an end of suffering in this very life.”
ai-an6:61.7.1_0: When this was said, one of the senior mendicants asked those senior mendicants,
ai-an6:61.7.2_0: “The six interior sense fields, reverends, are one end. The six exterior sense fields are the second end. Consciousness is the middle. And craving is the seamstress ...
ai-an6:61.7.4_0: That’s how a mendicant directly knows what should be directly known and completely understands what should be completely understood. Knowing and understanding thus they make an end of suffering in this very life.”
ai-an6:61.8.1_0: When this was said, one of the senior mendicants asked those senior mendicants,
ai-an6:61.8.2_0: “Identity, reverends, is one end. The origin of identity is the second end. The cessation of identity is the middle. And craving is the seamstress,
ai-an6:61.8.4_0: That’s how a mendicant directly knows what should be directly known and completely understands what should be completely understood. Knowing and understanding thus they make an end of suffering in this very life.”
ai-an6:61.9.1_0: When this was said, one of the senior mendicants asked those senior mendicants,
ai-an6:61.9.2_0: “Each of us has spoken from our heart.
ai-an6:61.9.3_0: Come, reverends, let’s go to the Buddha, and inform him about this.
ai-an6:61.9.4_0: As he answers, so we’ll remember it.”
ai-an6:61.10.2_0: Then those senior mendicants went up to the Buddha.
ai-an6:61.10.2_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-an6:61.10.3_0: and informed the Buddha of all they had discussed. They asked,
ai-an6:61.10.5_0: “Mendicants, you’ve all spoken well in a way. However, this is what I was referring to in ‘The Way to the Beyond’, in ‘The Questions of Metteyya’ when I said:
ai-an6:61.11.2_0: by the middle, they gain a profession.
ai-an6:61.11.3_0: I declare you the great man,
ai-an6:61.11.4_0: he has escaped the seamstress here.’
ai-an6:61.12.1_0: listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an6:61.12.4_0: “Contact, mendicants, is one end. The origin of contact is the second end. The cessation of contact is the middle. And craving is the seamstress,
ai-an6:61.12.6_0: That’s how a mendicant directly knows what should be directly known and completely understands what should be completely understood. Knowing and understanding thus they make an end of suffering in this very life.”
ai-an6:62.0.3_0: 62. Knowledge of the Faculties of Persons
ai-an6:62.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants when he arrived at a town of the Kosalans named Daṇḍakappaka.
ai-an6:62.1.3_0: The Buddha left the road and sat at the root of a tree on the seat spread out.
ai-an6:62.1.4_0: The mendicants entered Daṇḍakappaka to look for a guest house.
ai-an6:62.2.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda together with several mendicants went to the Aciravati River to bathe.
ai-an6:62.2.2_0: When he had bathed and emerged from the water he stood in one robe drying himself.
ai-an6:62.2.3_0: Then a certain mendicant went up to Venerable Ānanda,
ai-an6:62.2.3_1: Then the Buddha said to Ānanda,
ai-an6:62.2.4_0: “Reverend Ānanda, when the Buddha declared that Devadatta was
ai-an6:62.2.5_0: going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable, did he do so after wholeheartedly deliberating, or was this just a way of speaking?”
ai-an6:62.2.6_0: “You’re right, reverend, that’s how the Buddha declared it.”
ai-an6:62.3.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-an6:62.3.2_0: “Sir, several mendicants together with a number of monks went to the Aciravati River to bathe.
ai-an6:62.3.3_0: When he had bathed and emerged from the water he stood in one robe drying himself.
ai-an6:62.3.4_0: Then a certain mendicant went up to me and said:
ai-an6:62.3.5_0: ‘Reverend Ānanda, when the Buddha declared that Devadatta was
ai-an6:62.3.6_0: Devadatta is going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable, or did he do so after wholeheartedly deliberating?’
ai-an6:62.3.7_0: When they said this, I said to him:
ai-an6:62.4.1_0: “Ānanda, that mendicant must be junior, recently gone forth, or else a foolish, incompetent senior mendicant.
ai-an6:62.4.2_0: How on earth can he take something that I have declared definitively to be ambiguous?
ai-an6:62.4.3_0: I do not see a single other person concerning whom I have made a declaration about after giving such wholehearted deliberation as Devadatta.

ai-an6:62.4.5_0: I did not declare that he was

ai-an6:62.4.9_0: going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

ai-an6:62.5.2_0: and someone was sunk into it over their head.
ai-an6:62.5.3_0: Then along comes a person who wants to help make them safe, who wants to lift them out of that sewer.
ai-an6:62.5.4_0: But circling all around the sewer they couldn’t see even a fraction of a hair’s tip on that person that was not smeared with feces.
ai-an6:62.5.5_0: In the same way, when I saw that there was not even a fraction of a hair’s tip of goodness in Devadatta
ai-an6:62.5.7_0: going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

ai-an6:62.10.2_0: “Sir, can you describe three other persons who are counterparts of these three?”

ai-an6:63.1.1_0: “Mendicants, I will teach you a penetrative exposition of the teaching.
ai-an6:63.1.2_0: listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an6:63.2.1_0: “Mendicants, what is the penetrative exposition of the teaching?
ai-an6:63.2.2_0: Sensual pleasures should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.
ai-an6:63.3.1_0: Feelings should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.
ai-an6:63.4.1_0: Perceptions should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.
ai-an6:63.5.1_0: Defilements should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.
ai-an6:63.6.1_0: Deeds should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.
ai-an6:63.7.1_0: Suffering should be known. And its source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation should be known.
ai-an6:63.8.1_0: ‘Sensual pleasures should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’ That’s what I said,
ai-an6:63.8.2_0: And what did I say about this?
ai-an6:63.8.3_0: There are these five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-an6:63.8.4_0: Sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.
ai-an6:63.8.5_0: There are sounds known by the ear ...
ai-an6:63.8.8_0: Touches known by the body that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.
ai-an6:63.8.9_0: However, these are not sensual pleasures. In the training of the Noble One they’re called ‘kinds of sensual stimulation’.
ai-an6:63.8.10_0: Greedy intention is a person’s sensual pleasure:
ai-an6:63.8.11_0: The world’s pretty things aren’t sensual pleasures.
ai-an6:63.8.12_0: Greedy intention is a person’s sensual pleasure:
ai-an6:63.8.13_0: The world’s pretty things stay just as they are,
ai-an6:63.8.14_0: but a wise one removes desire for them.
ai-an6:63.9.1_0: And what is the source of sensual pleasures?
ai-an6:63.11.1_0: And what is the diversity of sensual pleasures?
ai-an6:63.11.2_0: The sensual desire for sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches are all different.
ai-an6:63.11.3_0: This is called the diversity of sensual pleasures.
ai-an6:63.12.1_0: And what is the result of sensual pleasures?
ai-an6:63.12.2_0: When one who desires sensual pleasures creates a corresponding life-form, with the attributes of either good or bad deeds—this is called the result of sensual pleasures.
ai-an6:63.13.1_0: And what is the cessation of sensual pleasures?
ai-an6:63.13.2_0: When contact ceases, sensual pleasures cease.
ai-an6:63.13.3_0: The practice that leads to the cessation of sensual pleasures is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-an6:63.13.4_0: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-an6:63.14.1_0: When a noble disciple understands sensual pleasures in this way—and understands their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation—they understand that this penetrative spiritual life is the cessation of sensual pleasures.
ai-an6:63.14.2_0: ‘Sensual pleasures should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’
ai-an6:63.14.3_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-an6:63.15.1_0: ‘Feeling should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’
ai-an6:63.15.2_0: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
ai-an6:63.16.1_0: And what is the source of feelings?
ai-an6:63.17.1_0: And what is the diversity of feelings?
ai-an6:63.17.2_0: There are material pleasant feelings, spiritual pleasant feelings, material painful feelings, spiritual painful feelings, material neutral feelings, and spiritual neutral feelings.
ai-an6:63.17.3_0: This is called the diversity of feelings.
ai-an6:63.18.1_0: And what is the result of feelings?
ai-an6:63.18.2_0: When one who feels creates a corresponding life-form, with the attributes of either good or bad deeds—
ai-an6:63.18.3_0: this is called the result of feelings.
ai-an6:63.19.1_0: And what is the cessation of feelings?
ai-an6:63.19.3_0: The practice that leads to the cessation of feelings is simply this noble eightfold path ...
ai-an6:63.19.4_0: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-an6:63.20.1_0: When a noble disciple understands feelings in this way ... they understand that this penetrative spiritual life is the cessation of feelings.
ai-an6:63.20.2_0: ‘Feeling should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’
ai-an6:63.20.3_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-an6:63.21.1_0: ‘Perceptions should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’
ai-an6:63.21.2_0: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
ai-an6:63.21.4_0: perception of sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts.
ai-an6:63.22.1_0: And what is the source of perceptions?
ai-an6:63.23.1_0: And what is the diversity of perceptions?
ai-an6:63.23.2_0: The perceptions of sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts are all different.
ai-an6:63.23.3_0: This is called the diversity of perceptions.
ai-an6:63.24.1_0: And what is the result of perceptions?
ai-an6:63.24.2_0: Communication is the result of perception, I say.
ai-an6:63.24.3_0: You communicate something in whatever manner you perceive it, saying ‘That’s what I perceived.’
ai-an6:63.24.4_0: This is called the result of perceptions.
ai-an6:63.25.1_0: And what is the cessation of perception?
ai-an6:63.25.3_0: The practice that leads to the cessation of perceptions is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-an6:63.25.4_0: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-an6:63.26.1_0: When a noble disciple understands perception in this way ... they understand that this penetrative spiritual life is the cessation of perception.
ai-an6:63.26.2_0: ‘Perceptions should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’
ai-an6:63.26.3_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-an6:63.27.1_0: ‘Defilements should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’
ai-an6:63.27.2_0: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
ai-an6:63.27.4_0: the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.
ai-an6:63.28.1_0: And what is the source of defilements?
ai-an6:63.28.2_0: Ignorance is the source of defilements.
ai-an6:63.29.1_0: And what is the diversity of defilements?
ai-an6:63.29.2_0: There are defilements that lead to rebirth in hell, the animal realm, the ghost realm, the human world, and the world of the gods.
ai-an6:63.29.3_0: This is called the diversity of defilements.
ai-an6:63.30.1_0: And what is the result of defilements?
ai-an6:63.30.2_0: When one who is ignorant creates a corresponding life-form, with the attributes of either good or bad deeds—this is called the result of defilements.
ai-an6:63.31.1_0: And what is the cessation of defilements?
ai-an6:63.31.3_0: The practice that leads to the cessation of defilements is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-an6:63.31.4_0: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-an6:63.32.1_0: When a noble disciple understands defilements in this way ... they understand that this penetrative spiritual life is the cessation of defilements.
ai-an6:63.32.2_0: ‘Defilements should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’
ai-an6:63.32.3_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-an6:63.33.1_0: ‘Deeds should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’ That’s what I said,
ai-an6:63.33.2_0: And what did I say about this?
ai-an6:63.33.3_0: It is intention that I call deeds.
ai-an6:63.33.4_0: For after making a choice one acts
ai-an6:63.33.5_0: by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an6:63.34.1_0: And what is the source of deeds?
ai-an6:63.35.1_0: And what is the diversity of deeds?
ai-an6:63.35.2_0: There are deeds that lead to rebirth in hell, the animal realm, the ghost realm, the human world, and the world of the gods.
ai-an6:63.35.3_0: This is called the diversity of deeds.
ai-an6:63.36.1_0: And what is the result of deeds?
ai-an6:63.36.2_0: The result of deeds is threefold, I say:
ai-an6:63.36.3_0: in this very life, on rebirth in the next life, or at some later time.
ai-an6:63.36.4_0: This is called the result of deeds.
ai-an6:63.37.1_0: And what is the cessation of deeds?
ai-an6:63.37.3_0: The practice that leads to the cessation of deeds is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-an6:63.37.4_0: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-an6:63.38.1_0: When a noble disciple understands deeds in this way ... they understand that this penetrative spiritual life is the cessation of deeds.
ai-an6:63.38.2_0: ‘Deeds should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’
ai-an6:63.38.3_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-an6:63.39.1_0: Suffering should be known. And its source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation should be known.
ai-an6:63.39.2_0: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
ai-an6:63.39.3_0: Rebirth is suffering; old age is suffering; illness is suffering; death is suffering; sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress are suffering; not getting what you wish for is suffering. In brief, the five grasping aggregates are suffering.
ai-an6:63.40.1_0: And what is the source of suffering?
ai-an6:63.40.2_0: Craving is the source of suffering.
ai-an6:63.41.1_0: And what is the diversity of suffering?
ai-an6:63.41.2_0: There is suffering that is severe, mild, slow to fade, and quick to fade.
ai-an6:63.41.3_0: This is called the diversity of suffering.
ai-an6:63.42.1_0: And what is the result of suffering?
ai-an6:63.42.2_0: It’s when someone who is overcome and overwhelmed by suffering sorrows and wails and laments, beating their breast and falling into confusion. Or else, overcome by that suffering, they begin an external search, wondering:
ai-an6:63.42.3_0: ‘Who knows one or two phrases to stop this suffering?’
ai-an6:63.42.4_0: The result of suffering is either confusion or a search, I say.
ai-an6:63.42.5_0: This is called the result of suffering.
ai-an6:63.43.1_0: And what is the cessation of suffering?
ai-an6:63.43.3_0: The practice that leads to the cessation of suffering is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-an6:63.43.4_0: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-an6:63.44.1_0: When a noble disciple understands suffering in this way ... they understand that this penetrative spiritual life is the cessation of suffering.
ai-an6:63.44.2_0: Suffering should be known. And its source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation should be known.
ai-an6:63.44.3_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-an6:63.45.1_0: This is the penetrative exposition of the teaching.”
ai-an6:64.1.1_0: “Mendicants, the Realized One possesses six powers of a Realized One. With these he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.
ai-an6:64.1.3_0: Firstly, the Realized One truly understands the possible as possible, and the impossible as impossible.
ai-an6:64.1.4_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. Relying on this he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.
ai-an6:64.2.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands the result of deeds undertaken in the past, future, and present in terms of causes and reasons.
ai-an6:64.2.2_0: Since he truly understands this, this is a power of the Realized One. ...
ai-an6:64.3.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One truly understands corruption, cleansing, and emergence regarding the absorptions, liberations, immersions, and attainments.
ai-an6:64.3.2_1: The Realized One has a power of the Realized One. With these he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.
ai-an6:64.4.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One recollects many kinds of past lives.
ai-an6:64.4.1_1: There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-an6:64.5.1_0: Furthermore, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, the Realized One sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place.
ai-an6:64.5.1_1: They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-an6:64.6.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And he lives having realized it with his own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an6:64.6.2_1: The Realized One has realized the power of a Realized One. Relying on this he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.
ai-an6:64.6.3_0: These are the six powers of a Realized One that the Realized One possesses. With these he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.
ai-an6:64.7.1_0: If others come to the Realized One and ask questions about his true knowledge of the possible as possible and the impossible as impossible,
ai-an6:64.7.2_0: the Realized One answers them in whatever manner he has truly known it.
ai-an6:64.8.1_0: If others come to the Realized One and ask questions about his true knowledge of the result of deeds undertaken in the past, future, and present in terms of causes and reasons,
ai-an6:64.8.2_0: the Realized One answers them in whatever manner he has truly known it.
ai-an6:64.9.1_0: If others come to the Realized One and ask questions about his true knowledge of corruption, cleansing, and emergence regarding the absorptions, liberations, immersions, and attainments,
ai-an6:64.9.2_0: the Realized One answers them in whatever manner he has truly known it.
ai-an6:64.10.1_0: If others come to the Realized One and ask questions about his true knowledge of recollection of past lives,
ai-an6:64.10.2_0: the Realized One answers them in whatever manner he has truly known it.
ai-an6:64.11.1_0: If others come to the Realized One and ask questions about his true knowledge of passing away and rebirth of sentient beings,
ai-an6:64.11.2_0: the Realized One answers them in whatever manner he has truly known it.
ai-an6:64.12.1_0: If others realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life,
ai-an6:64.12.1_1: They went to ask and questions about the future.
ai-an6:64.12.2_0: the Realized One has ended the defilements,
ai-an6:64.12.2_1: The Realized One truly understands the ending of defilements.
ai-an6:64.13.1_0: And I say that true knowledge of the possible as possible and the impossible as impossible is for those with immersion, not for those without immersion.
ai-an6:64.13.2_0: And true knowledge of the result of deeds undertaken in the past, future, and present in terms of causes and reasons is for those with immersion, not for those without immersion.
ai-an6:64.13.3_0: And true knowledge of corruption, cleansing, and emergence regarding the absorptions, liberations, immersions, and attainments is for those with immersion, not for those without immersion.
ai-an6:64.13.4_0: And true knowledge of the recollection of past lives is for those with immersion, not for those without immersion.
ai-an6:64.13.5_0: And true knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of sentient beings is for those with immersion, not for those without immersion.
ai-an6:64.13.6_0: And true knowledge of the ending of defilements is for those with immersion, not for those without immersion.
ai-an6:64.13.7_0: And so, mendicants, immersion is the path. No immersion is the wrong path.”
ai-an6:64.13.9_0: The sixth sub-chapter on greatness is finished.

ai-an6:67.1.1_0: “Mendicants, it’s totally impossible that a mendicant with bad friends, companions, and associates, while frequenting, accompanying, and attending, and following their example, will fulfill the practice dealing with the supplementary regulations.
ai-an6:67.1.2_0: Without fulfilling the supplementary regulations, it’s impossible to fulfill the teaching.
ai-an6:67.1.3_0: Without fulfilling the practice of a trainee, it’s impossible to fulfill ethics.
ai-an6:67.1.4_0: Without fulfilling ethics, it’s impossible give up desire to be reborn in the realm of luminous form or in the formless realm.

ai-an6:67.2.3_0: Having fulfilled the practice of a trainee, it’s possible to fulfill ethics.
ai-an6:67.2.4_0: Having fulfilled ethics, it’s possible give up desire to be reborn in the realm of luminous form or in the formless realm.”
ai-an6:68.1.1_0: “Mendicants, it’s totally impossible that a mendicant who enjoys company and groups, who loves them and likes to enjoy them, should take pleasure in being alone in seclusion.
ai-an6:68.1.2_0: Without taking pleasure in being alone in seclusion, it’s impossible to learn the patterns of the mind.
ai-an6:68.1.3_0: Without learning the patterns of the mind, it’s impossible to fulfill right view.
ai-an6:68.1.4_0: Without fulfilling right view, it’s impossible to fulfill right immersion.
ai-an6:68.1.5_0: Without fulfilling right immersion, it’s impossible to give up the fetters.
ai-an6:68.1.6_0: Without giving up the fetters, it’s impossible to realize extinguishment.
ai-an6:68.2.1_0: It’s totally possible that a mendicant who doesn’t enjoy company and groups, who doesn’t love them and like to enjoy them, should take pleasure in being alone in seclusion.
ai-an6:68.2.2_0: For someone who takes pleasure in being alone in seclusion, it’s possible to learn the patterns of the mind.
ai-an6:68.2.3_0: For someone who learns the patterns of the mind, it’s possible to fulfill right view.
ai-an6:68.2.4_0: Having fulfilled right view, it’s possible to fulfill right immersion.
ai-an6:68.2.5_0: Having fulfilled right immersion, it’s possible to give up the fetters.
ai-an6:68.2.6_0: Having given up the fetters, it’s possible to realize extinguishment.”
ai-an6:69.1.1_0: Then, late at night, a glorious deity, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha, and,
ai-an6:69.1.1_2: She bowed, stood to one side, and said to him,
ai-an6:69.1.2_0: “Sir, these six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.
ai-an6:69.1.3_0: What are the teachings grouped by six?
ai-an6:69.1.4_0: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training, for good friends.
ai-an6:69.1.5_0: These six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.”
ai-an6:69.1.6_0: That is what that deity said
ai-an6:69.1.8_0: Then that deity, knowing that the teacher approved, bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.
ai-an6:69.2.1_0: Then, when the night had passed, the Buddha told the mendicants all that had happened, repeating all the verses spoken. Then he added:
ai-an6:69.2.2_0: “Mendicants, tonight, a glorious deity, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, came to me,
ai-an6:69.2.3_0: ‘Sir, these six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.
ai-an6:69.2.4_0: What are the teachings grouped by six?
ai-an6:69.2.5_0: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training, for good friends.
ai-an6:69.2.6_0: These six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.’
ai-an6:69.2.7_0: This is what that deity said,
ai-an6:69.2.8_0: Then he bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right side, before vanishing right there.”

ai-an6:72.2.4_0: A mendicant who has these six qualities can attain strength in immersion.”
ai-an6:73.1.1_0: “Mendicants, without giving up six things you can’t enter and remain in the first absorption.

ai-an6:73.1.4_0: And the drawbacks of sensual pleasures have been truly seen clearly with right wisdom.
ai-an6:73.1.5_0: Without giving up these six qualities you can’t enter and remain in the first absorption.
ai-an6:73.2.1_0: But after giving up six qualities you can enter and remain in the first absorption.

ai-an6:75.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when a mendicant has six qualities they live unhappily in the present life—with distress, anguish, and fever—and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a bad rebirth.
ai-an6:75.1.3_0: Sensual, malicious, and cruel thoughts; and sensual, malicious, and cruel perceptions.
ai-an6:75.1.4_0: When a mendicant has these six qualities they live unhappily in the present life—with distress, anguish, and fever—and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a bad rebirth.
ai-an6:75.2.1_0: When a mendicant has six qualities they live happily in the present life—without distress, anguish, or fever—and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a good rebirth.

ai-an6:75.2.4_0: When a mendicant has these six qualities they live happily in the present life—without distress, anguish, or fever—and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a good rebirth.”

ai-an6:76.2.4_0: After giving up these six things you can realize perfection.”
ai-an6:77.1.1_0: “Mendicants, without giving up six qualities you can’t realize a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.
ai-an6:77.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by six?
ai-an6:77.1.3_0: Not guarding the sense doors, eating too much, and they eat too much.

ai-an6:78.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when a mendicant has six things they’re full of joy and happiness in the present life, and they have laid the groundwork for ending the defilements.
ai-an6:78.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant enjoys the teaching, meditation, giving up, seclusion, kindness, and non-proliferation.
ai-an6:78.1.4_0: When a mendicant has these six things they’re full of joy and happiness in the present life, and they have laid the groundwork for ending the defilements.”
ai-an6:79.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant who has six factors is unable to acquire more skillful qualities or to increase the skillful qualities they’ve already acquired.
ai-an6:79.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant is not skilled in profit, skilled in loss, and skilled in means. They don’t generate enthusiasm to achieve skillful qualities not yet achieved. They don’t protect skillful qualities they have achieved. And they don’t try to persevere in the task.
ai-an6:79.1.4_0: A mendicant who has these six factors is unable to acquire more skillful qualities or to increase the skillful qualities they’ve already acquired.
ai-an6:79.2.1_0: A mendicant who has six factors is able to acquire more skillful qualities or to increase the skillful qualities they’ve already acquired.
ai-an6:79.2.3_0: It’s when a mendicant is skilled in profit, skilled in loss, and skilled in means. They generate enthusiasm to achieve skillful qualities not yet achieved. They protect skillful qualities they have achieved. And they try to persevere in the task.
ai-an6:79.2.4_0: A mendicant who has these six factors is able to acquire more skillful qualities or to increase the skillful qualities they’ve already acquired.”
ai-an6:80.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant with six qualities soon acquires great and abundant good qualities.
ai-an6:80.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant is full of light, full of practice, full of inspiration, and full of eagerness. They don’t slack off when it comes to developing skillful qualities. They reach further.
ai-an6:80.1.4_0: A mendicant who has these six qualities soon acquires great and abundant good qualities.”
ai-an6:81.1.1_0: “Mendicants, someone with six qualities is cast down to hell.
ai-an6:81.1.3_0: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, and lie. And they have wicked desires and wrong view.
ai-an6:81.1.4_0: Someone with these six qualities is cast down to hell.
ai-an6:81.2.1_0: Someone with six qualities is raised up to heaven.
ai-an6:81.2.3_0: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, or lie. And they have few desires and right view.
ai-an6:81.2.4_0: Someone with these six qualities is raised up to heaven.”
ai-an6:82.1.1_0: “Mendicants, someone with six qualities is cast down to hell.
ai-an6:82.1.3_0: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, and lie. And they’re greedy and impudent.
ai-an6:82.1.4_0: Someone with these six qualities is cast down to hell.
ai-an6:82.2.1_0: Someone with six qualities is raised up to heaven.
ai-an6:82.2.3_0: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, or lie. And they’re not greedy or impudent.
ai-an6:82.2.4_0: Someone with these six qualities is raised up to heaven.”
ai-an6:83.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant with six qualities can’t realize the best thing, perfection.
ai-an6:83.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant is faithless, shameless, imprudent, lazy, and witless. And they’re concerned with their body and their life.
ai-an6:83.1.4_0: A mendicant with these six qualities can’t realize the best thing, perfection.
ai-an6:83.2.1_0: A mendicant with six qualities can realize the best thing, perfection.
ai-an6:83.2.3_0: It’s when a mendicant is faithful, conscientious, prudent, energetic, and wise. And they have no concern for their body and their life.
ai-an6:83.2.4_0: A mendicant with these six qualities can realize the best thing, perfection.”
ai-an6:84.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant with six qualities can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an6:84.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant has many desires—they’re frustrated and not content with any kind of robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick. And they’re faithless, unethical, unmindful, and witless.
ai-an6:84.1.4_0: A mendicant with these six qualities can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an6:84.2.1_0: A mendicant with six qualities can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
ai-an6:84.2.3_0: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t have many desires—they’re not frustrated but content with any kind of robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick. And they’re faithful, ethical, mindful, and wise.
ai-an6:84.2.4_0: A mendicant with these six qualities can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.”
ai-an6:84.2.6_0: The eighth sub-chapter on perfection is finished.
ai-an6:85.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant with six qualities can’t realize supreme coolness.
ai-an6:85.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t keep their mind in check when they should. They don’t exert their mind when they should. They don’t encourage the mind when they should. ai-an6:85.1.4_0: A mendicant with these six qualities can’t realize supreme coolness.

ai-an6:85.2.3_0: It’s when a mendicant keeps their mind in check when they should. They exert their mind when they should. They encourage the mind when they should. They watch over the mind with equanimity when they should. They have an excellent attitude. They delight in extinguishment.
ai-an6:85.2.4_0: A mendicant with these six qualities can realize supreme coolness.”

ai-an6:86.1.1_0: “Mendicants, having six qualities the true teaching is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities.
ai-an6:86.1.3_0: They’re obstructed by deeds, defilements, or results. And they’re faithless, unenthusiastic, and witless.
ai-an6:86.1.4_0: Someone with these six qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
ai-an6:86.2.1_0: After listening to the true teaching, they enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities.
ai-an6:86.2.3_0: They’re not obstructed by deeds, defilements, or results. And they’re faithful, enthusiastic, and wise.
ai-an6:86.2.4_0: Having these six qualities enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, listening to the true teaching.”
ai-an6:87.1.1_0: “Mendicants, having six qualities the true teaching is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities.
ai-an6:87.1.3_0: They murder their mother or father or a perfected one. They maliciously shed the blood of a Realized One. They cause a schism in the Saṅgha. They’re witless, dull, and stupid.
ai-an6:87.1.4_0: Someone with these six qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
ai-an6:87.2.1_0: After listening to the true teaching, they enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities.
ai-an6:87.2.3_0: They don’t murder their mother or father or a perfected one. They don’t maliciously shed the blood of a Realized One. They don’t cause a schism in the Saṅgha. They’re wise, bright, and clever.
ai-an6:87.2.4_0: Having these six qualities enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, listening to the true teaching.”
ai-an6:88.1.1_0: “Mendicants, having six qualities the true teaching is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities.
ai-an6:88.1.3_0: When the teaching and practice proclaimed by the Realized One is being taught they don’t want to listen. They don’t lend an ear or apply their mind to understand them. They learn the incorrect meaning and reject the correct meaning. They accept views that contradict the teaching.
ai-an6:88.1.4_0: Someone with these six qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
ai-an6:88.2.1_0: After listening to the true teaching, they enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities.

ai-an6:89.1.1_0: “Mendicants, without giving up six things you can’t become accomplished in view.
ai-an6:89.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by six?
ai-an6:89.1.3_0: Identity view, doubt, misapprehension of precepts and observances, and forms of greed, hate, and delusion that follow.
ai-an6:89.1.4_0: Without giving up these six things you can’t become accomplished in view.
ai-an6:89.2.1_0: After giving up six things you can become accomplished in view.
ai-an6:89.2.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by six?
ai-an6:89.2.3_0: Identity view, doubt, misapprehension of precepts and observances, and forms of greed, hate, and delusion that follow.
ai-an6:89.2.4_0: After giving up these six things you can become accomplished in view.”
ai-an6:90.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a person accomplished in view has given up six things.
ai-an6:90.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by six?
ai-an6:90.1.3_0: Identity view, doubt, misapprehension of precepts and observances, and forms of greed, hate, and delusion that lead to rebirth in places of loss.
ai-an6:90.1.4_0: A person accomplished in view has given up these six things.”

ai-an6:91.1.4_0: A person accomplished in view can’t give rise to these six things.”

ai-an6:92.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these six reasons that can’t stand.
ai-an6:92.1.3_0: A person accomplished in view can’t live disrespectful and irreverent toward the Teacher, the teaching, the Saṅgha, or the training. They can’t establish their belief on unreliable grounds. And they can’t generate an eighth rebirth.
ai-an6:92.1.4_0: These are the six reasons to stand.”
ai-an6:93.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these six reasons that can’t stand.
ai-an6:93.1.3_0: A person accomplished in view can’t take conditions to be permanent, happiness, or self. They can’t do deeds with fixed result in the next life. They can’t fall back on purification through noisy, superstious rites. They can’t seek outside of the Buddhist community for those worthy of religious donations.
ai-an6:93.1.4_0: These are the six reasons to stand.”
ai-an6:94.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these six reasons that can’t stand.
ai-an6:94.1.3_0: A person accomplished in view can’t murder their mother or father or a perfected one. They can’t maliciously shed the blood of the Realized One. They can’t cause a schism in the Saṅgha. They can’t acknowledge another teacher.
ai-an6:94.1.4_0: These are the six reasons to stand.”
ai-an6:95.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these six reasons that can’t stand.
ai-an6:95.1.3_0: A person accomplished in view can’t fall back on the idea that pleasure and pain are made by oneself, or that they’re made by another, or that they’re made by both. Nor can they fall back on the idea that pleasure and pain arise by chance, not made by oneself, by another, or by both.
ai-an6:95.1.5_0: It is because a person accomplished in view has clearly seen causes and the phenomena that arise from causes.
ai-an6:95.1.6_0: These are the six reasons to stand.”

ai-an6:97.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by six?
ai-an6:97.1.3_0: You’re bound for the true teaching. You’re not liable to decline. You suffer only for a limited period. You have unshared knowledge. You’ve clearly seen causes and the phenomena that arise from causes.

ai-an6:98.2.2_0: Having accepted views that agree with the teaching, it’s possible to enter the sure path.
ai-an6:98.2.3_0: Having entered the sure path, it’s possible to realize the fruit of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, or perfection.”

ai-an6:102.1.1_0: “Mendicants, seeing six benefits is quite enough to establish the perception of impermanence in all conditions without qualification.
ai-an6:102.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by six?
ai-an6:102.1.3_0: ‘All conditions will appear to me as transient.’ ‘My mind will not delight anywhere in the world.’ ‘My mind will rise above the whole world.’ ‘My mind will incline to extinguishment.’ ‘My fetters will be given up.’ ‘I will achieve the ultimate goal of the ascetic life.’
ai-an6:102.1.4_0: Seeing these six benefits is quite enough to establish the perception of impermanence in all conditions without qualification.”
ai-an6:103.1.1_0: “Mendicants, seeing six benefits is quite enough to establish the perception of suffering in all conditions without qualification.
ai-an6:103.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by six?
ai-an6:103.1.3_0: ‘Perception of disillusionment will be established in me for all conditions, like a killer with a drawn sword.’
ai-an6:103.1.4_0: ‘My mind will rise above the whole world.’ ‘I will see extinguishment as peaceful.’ ‘My underlying tendencies will be uprooted.’ ‘I will fulfill my duty.’ ‘I will have served my Teacher with love.’
ai-an6:103.1.5_0: Seeing these six benefits is quite enough to establish the perception of suffering in all conditions without qualification.”
ai-an6:104.1.1_0: “Mendicants, seeing six benefits is quite enough to establish the perception of not-self in all things without qualification.
ai-an6:104.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by six?
ai-an6:104.1.3_0: ‘I will be without identification in the whole world.’ ‘My I-makings will stop.’ ‘My mine-makings will stop.’ ‘I will have unshared knowledge.’ ‘I will clearly see causes and the phenomena that arise from causes.’
ai-an6:104.1.4_0: Seeing these six benefits is quite enough to establish the perception of not-self in all things without qualification.”
ai-an6:105.1.1_0: “Mendicants, you should give up these three states of existence. And you should train in three trainings.

ai-an6:105.1.4_0: These are the three states of existence you should give up.
ai-an6:105.1.5_0: What are the three trainings you should train in?
ai-an6:105.1.6_0: The training in the higher ethics, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom.
ai-an6:105.1.7_0: You should train in these three trainings.

ai-an6:105.1.9_0: This is called a mendicant who has cut off craving, untied the fetters, and by rightly comprehending conceit has made an end of suffering.”

ai-an6:106.1.9_0: This is called a mendicant who has cut off craving, untied the fetters, and by rightly comprehending conceit has made an end of suffering.”
